title: Real-time strategy
summary: Real-time strategy (RTS) is a subgenre of strategy video games that do not progress incrementally in turns,[1] but allow all players to play simultaneously, in "real time".  By contrast, in turn-based strategy (TBS) games, players take turns to play. The term "real-time strategy" was coined by Brett Sperry to market Dune II in the early 1990s.[2][3]
